articles.description: Follow live commentary and text updates as three-time champions New Zealand face Italy in Lyon.
articles.title: New Zealand face Italy in must-win World Cup match - radio & text

articles.description: Europe open a healthy 6½-1½ lead over the United States after a sensational opening day of the Ryder Cup.
articles.title: Europe open big lead over US in Ryder Cup

articles.description: An historic undisputed heavyweight fight between champions Tyson Fury and Oleksandr Usyk has been "signed", according to Queensbury Promotions.
articles.title: Fury to face Usyk in undisputed title fight in Saudi

articles.description: Follow live text coverage and BBC radio commentary of Hull KR v Leigh Leopards in the Super League elimination play-off.
articles.title: Super League elimination play-off: Hull KR v Leigh Leopards - radio & text

articles.description: Follow live score & text updates as Sheffield Wednesday host Sunderland in the EFL Championship.
articles.title: Championship: Sheff Wed 0-2 Sunderland - Black Cats race into lead

articles.description: Follow live text commentary as Barcelona host Sevilla at the Estadi Olimpic Lluis Companys in La Liga.
articles.title: La Liga: Barcelona host Sevilla - follow live

articles.description: Watch some of the best shots from day one of the Ryder Cup, featuring Tyrrell Hatton, Max Homa, Rory McIlroy, Rickie Fowler and three from Jon Rahm.
articles.title: Rahm stars as Europe take big lead - shots of the day

articles.description: Players are "scared" and "worried" at the raft of anterior cruciate knee ligament injuries in women's football, says Birmingham City's Siobhan Wilson.
articles.title: Female footballers 'scared' about rise in ACL injuries

articles.description: Middlesex are relegated after just one season back in Division One of the County Championship following a dramatic final-day defeat by Nottinghamshire.
articles.title: Middlesex relegated after dramatic defeat by Notts

articles.description: Justin Rose holds his nerve to sink a putt to claim another half point for Europe as they open a healthy 6½-1½ lead over the United States on day one of the Ryder Cup in Rome.
articles.title: Rose holds nerve to claw back another half point
